                              ANALYSIS ASSUMPTIONS

Wolcott Interchange (Bellyache Ridge Road)

                         I-70 WB Ramp      3/15/2011       7:30      0.899        4:15        0.846 Side-street Stop     LT         TR          -       LTR

Bellyache Ridge Road at US 6               3/15/2011       7:30      0.870        4:30       0.918 Side-street Stop      LR          -          TR       LT
                                                                             Adj=4:15        0.881

US 6 at SH 131                             3/15/2011       7:30      0.856        4:30       0.914 Side-street Stop       -     TR (chan)       LT      T,R
                                                                             Adj=4:15        0.873

Edwards Interchange (Beard Creek Road/Edwards Access Road)
                       I-70 WB Ramp    2/9/2012      7:45            0.844      4:45         0.883 Roundabout (2)        L,T       T,TR          -     L, LTR
                                                Adj=7:30             0.833 Adj=5:00          0.873
                        I-70 EB Ramp   2/9/2012      7:30            0.926      5:00         0.939 Roundabout (2)       TR,R       LT,T        LTR,R     -

Assumptions and Adjustments (synchro):
Signal Timing at Eby Creek Road and I-70 WB Ramps is modeled with timings from East Eagle Study
Bellyache Ridge Road at US 6 and US 6 at SH 131 - Adjusted peak PM to 4:15PM
Eby Creek Road at I-70 EB Ramp - Adjusted peak PM to 4:45PM
Beard Creek Road at I-70 WB Ramp - Adjusted peak AM to 7:30AM and PM to 5:00PM
Balanced volumes between interchange intersections to equal 0, adjusted up. Placed balanced vehicles on through movements.
Balanced volumes between Wolcott Interchange and US 6 to equal 0.
Volumes for the Wolcott intersections (4 total, including interchanges, and ones on US 6) were grown to 2012 by 2.54% annual growth rate
PHF - Existing intersections, use existing PHF. New intersections, merge/diverge, freeway, and segments, use 0.95 (Future) [Source: E Eagle]
Truck Percentages - Used the higher value between measured and East Eagle Study
Reconfigured phasing at Signalized intersection (Eby Creek Road/I-70 WB) to conventional phasing (N-S as Phase 2 and 6)
Yellow 5 seconds was assumed to be 3 sec yellow and 2 second all-red

Assumptions and Adjustments (Sidra):
If volume equals 0, then it was changed to 1 for analysis to process.
Approach cruise speed as posted speed limit for other approaches. Exit cruise speed was posted speed.
Used Sidra Standard for Capacity Model (with Sign Control LOS) and HCM 2000 for LOS method.
Used 1.0 for Environmental factor on all roundabouts.
Used 'Medium' for Entry/Circulating Flow Adjustment.
Wolcott - assumed in Build that the provided crosswalks were analyzed with the following parameters: 20 peds/hour, PHF=0.95, Walking speed of 3.5 ft/s
Entered design parameters for approaches (Entry Radius, Entry Angle, Lane Widths, Island Diameter, Circulating Width
No adjustments to saturation flow rate. Used default of 1900 tcu/hour

Estimating 2020 and 2035 Background Volumes
Wolcott - Applied growth rate to 2012 numbers to get 2020 or 2035
Eagle - Used East Eagle Study. Took 2030 values, minus 2010 volumes, then reduced development traffic by 2.54% annually to 2020 or 2035, then added 2012 counts.
Edwards - Used 2035 volumes from study and applied 2.9% annually to grow to 2035 or reduce to 2020. Checked against growing 2012 to future year by 2.9% annually and it was very close. Study is more conservative.
East Eagle - Used East Eagle Study. Took 2030 values and altered by 2.54% annually to 2020 or 2035.

Level of Service (LOS) Method: Delay (HCM 2000).
Roundabout LOS Method: Same as Sign Control.
Vehicle movement LOS values are based on average delay per movement
Intersection and Approach LOS values are based on average delay for all vehicle movements.
Roundabout Capacity Model: SIDRA Standard.
SIDRA Standard Delay Model used.

Level of Service (LOS) Method: Delay (HCM 2000).
Roundabout LOS Method: Same as Sign Control.
Vehicle movement LOS values are based on average delay per movement
Intersection and Approach LOS values are based on average delay for all vehicle movements.
Roundabout Capacity Model: SIDRA Standard.

Level of Service (LOS) Method: Delay (HCM 2000).
Roundabout LOS Method: Same as Sign Control.
Vehicle movement LOS values are based on average delay per movement
Intersection and Approach LOS values are based on average delay for all vehicle movements.
Roundabout Capacity Model: SIDRA Standard.
SIDRA Standard Delay Model used.

                              2020 BUILD WITH IMPROVEMENTS 




 
MOVEMENT SUMMARY                                                                                                               Site: 2020 Build PM
Roundabout with 1-lane approaches and circulating road
MUTCD (FHWA 2009) example number: 2B-22
Roundabout Guide (TRB 2010) example number: A-1

Roundabout



 Movement Performance - Vehicles
